website_summaries.verdict: Wide waist belt on the harness yields a comfortable fit. Traditional design distributes pressure.
pros: Double straps on leg loops create a secure fit that can handle weight distribution well
Reasonable price point for a climbing harness, but it may pinch in some spots with little padding
Good construction means you can trust it to do the job
Some people love the extra wide waist belt
cons: May not fit larger bodies comfortably
Adjusting for the best fit is tricky

customer_reviews.title: Way to big
customer_reviews.text: Way to big. Seems well made but description (32" to ...) is misleading. I'm 5'7 180lb with 33" waist. At its tightest, the belt strap is about 2 inches too big and lifts up around my lower ribs. I had to send it back for a smaller harness.
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction
customer_reviews.text: My review is mostly for the quality construction of the harness. However I did not purchase it for climbing or zipline use. I wanted a belt with durable loops for a disabled patient. The patient goes into a rage and needs temporary restraints that would be quick to engage. Using wrist bracelets with carabiners it works fast with the harness keeping the patient from injuries. There are some medical product available but cost 10 to 12 times more than this harness. It easily supports the patients weight of 140 lbs and I'm no worries about the loops breaking. Then leg straps keep the belt from slipping up the waist so the harness fits this application better that other medical restraints.
customer_reviews.author: EMT

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: In the Amazon information about this product it states " ...will waist fit size 30 to 57..." This is why I purchased this particular harness. I have a size 46 inch waist. Upon receiving this belt and trying it on. It was two small. In the product manual that arrived with this harness it states that the maximum waist size to use this harness is 42 inches. The maximum weight to use this harness is 250 pounds. This pound limitation is not stated in the Amazon product description. I ended up giving this harness away to a friend because the item received is not as is described on the Amazon website.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, i am a big person. I recently took up rock climbing, and this was the only harness I could find that would work for me, so I am grateful this was available. It is comfortable and I feel safe in it. I have problems tightening the straps when I have it on though - I think it is more of a function of figuring it out. My climbing partner can adjust them.with minimal effort, I just can't do it myself. It is also great because it can be tightened on both sides so that it can be center comfortably on my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Bug Lover

customer_reviews.title: A great harness for the price
customer_reviews.text: A great harness for the price. It feels secure and comfortable. I'm a size 2-4 (women's) and there's a lot of extra material though. If that's something that bothers you, maybe look at a specifically women-oriented harness.
customer_reviews.author: lajk218

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable entry harness.
customer_reviews.text: I'm just getting into using a harness for climbing. I've used a lineman's belt and this is so much more comfortable for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Thick belt climbing harness
customer_reviews.text: It is certified to 25 Kn!! That's over 5000 pounds!! Update: In use as a belay, climbing and zip line harness, it is awesome. Comfortable to wear several hours of use at one time. Definitely would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: John Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Great harness
customer_reviews.text: Simple and comfortable. I like the adjustable leg loops. Easy to put on, even after your crampons are on. Gear loops are in perfect place and a haul loop. I use it for sport, big wall, and trad.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent harness that you’ll love.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent harness! The fit is very comfortable and the assembly really makes you feel safe. Great stitching throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shrek approved!!  Great harness!
customer_reviews.text: This harness is awesome! Great for us who are “not your average humans” who are really hard on gear and don’t fit into the Abercrombie mold. Great stitching and pretty comfy. I have total confidence in this harness when I’m hanging out. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: J-VanTheMan

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Little bit of a groin cutter when repelling but for the price it is great. I don't do a substantial amount of tree work anymore so when it came time to replace my saddle/harness I didn't want to spend a fortune on something that may see ten hours of use a year and probably only be young enough to climb for the next 10 years. Great bang for the buck! It feels sturdy and stitched well! Very lightweight but if you climb everyday for a living doing arborist work, maybe spring for something nicer
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Steele

customer_reviews.title: Value in entry level
customer_reviews.text: Ok for a beginner like myself. I weigh 190 lbs. i dont think its meant for people much heavier than that. I only used it a few times so far so cant speak to how well it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice harness.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use for mast climbing rig. Nice support, should work for described uses. Not a sport climbing harness but for working out of it, pretty comfortable...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Is this product worth the money?
customer_reviews.text: Yes. The construction and material are top notch. This harness is the best. Super inexpensive and well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: cattyL

customer_reviews.title: Saddle is good for a back up but is very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: A real nut pincher! Saddle is good for a back up but is very uncomfortable. D rings are small and hard to find in a pickle. Guess I can't complain for the cost but it will be retired real soon. It would be good for backpacking because it is extremely light and would be good to repel short distances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Fits perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Fits perfect. Tried it a few times already and i feel very safe and secure. tightens up the amount you need it to be. So far I've had no problems with it. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great belt for securing yourself to a ladder
customer_reviews.text: Great belt for securing yourself to a ladder. Works great and I haven't fallen off the ladder yet, but the strong winds we are having did blow the 24-foot ladder down. Fortunately, I was not on it at the time.
customer_reviews.author: SEllis

customer_reviews.title: I wear a size 33in waste and had trouble getting the harness tight around my ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 33in waste and had trouble getting the harness tight around my wast above my hip bones. The elastic straps that hold legs up kept pulling the straps up into my butt. Harness looks to be made great, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Only issue is that when not on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Only issue is that when not on the rope it try's to fall off with anything connected to the belt. Problem solved with a set of good suspenders.
customer_reviews.author: Bill and Pat McCutcheon

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, and didn’t pinch the boys
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far . Solid , comfortable, and didn’t pinch the boys , what else is there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good harness
customer_reviews.text: It's very comfy and the way you tighten the waist strap is easy and fast but the legs tighten in an odd way.
customer_reviews.author: trey

customer_reviews.title: Not fitting proverly
customer_reviews.text: It looks sturdy but Not comfortable. Not fitting Well. Back support is not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using them and they make climbing trees easier. Especially the tall Virginia pines where I live.
customer_reviews.author: Earon

customer_reviews.title: I got 2 of these and love them, yea they are heavier then most others
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these and love them, yea they are heavier then most others. But you feel really secure it them, and is that not what you want?
customer_reviews.author: Ang3La

customer_reviews.title: i liked it as a safety harness while on my staging
customer_reviews.text: i am changing my review on this product....I used it for a safety harness while siding my home, it was wonderful, every once in a while I needed to tighten it up, but I am sure it is because of my (hmmm) bigger belly. Today I used it for descending work and I personally feel that it is not sturdy enough for this type of work. But I will continue to use it as a safety harness while on staging.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: All in all it's a good piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: All in all it's a good piece of equipment. I would prefer the D rings were larger and positioned further forward. I use two straps on tree climbs and unlatching and latching is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works but the belts and buckles do not stay ...
customer_reviews.text: it works but the belts and buckles do not stay tight. have to be careful when not suspended that it doesn't come loose and fall off...
customer_reviews.author: matthew clark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I wanted, comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Cash

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, good value
customer_reviews.text: I used it to take down a tree. Worked great, good value.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stonecipher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This belt provides good support while working on towers. Back support is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: everything came on time and was the quality I expected..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good price for this product
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, good price for this product! And delivered on time!
customer_reviews.author: Rosalinda Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Can take some getting used to...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Little difficult to get the belt where you want it. Legs have a elastic setup that wants to pull up all the time but you can get used to it. Lightweight, easy to roll up for backpack
customer_reviews.author: Ken Jensen

customer_reviews.title: and he liked it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my brother who received it promptly, and he liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Earth Wisdom For You

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness - but sized too large
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well crafted high quality harness. The sizing however is off. I am a 32 waist and had to return this as the one I received was likely more a 35 waist. The company contacted me to find out why I was returning and on receiving my feedback regarding the sizing they sent a request to their manufacturer to see if this can be addressed. If they actually make a smaller size at the quality level of the one I received and returned due to the sizing issue I will purchase it. For the money this is one of the best constructed harness set ups I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just a very uncomfortable harness.
customer_reviews.text: Just a very uncomfortable harness. There are better harnesses out there in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon Party

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, dangerous item.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply built poor stiching. Utility loops both broke as soon as 10lbs of weight was put on them. Would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit in the legs like I expected them too
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Strong and built well, but did not fit my waist well.I am a 28-29 inch waist.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Well made sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: The harness is well made, it gives good support to the back and legs. like the ad says is designed to balance your body weight evenly which is very true. The seat belt material (polyester) is very strong and the stitching is done well to ensure safety, the buckles are also strong and sturdy although not quick release they are easy to use. It looks like this harness is made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

product_meta.title: Thicken Wider Climbing Harness, Oumers Protect Waist Version Waistbelt Wider Safe Seat Belts For Mountaineering Fire Rescue Higher Level Caving Rock Climbing Rappelling Equip Women Man Child Half Body
feature_bullets: Will fit: waist 30" to 59" ; Leg 17" to 31". Tension≥15KN, Impact force≤6KN. One size fit all.
Frame construction guarantees excellent weight distribution for optimal comfort: waistbelt and leg loops with doubled straps. waistbelt wider on the back and legs.
Traditional buckle, harness construction distributes pressure to keep you comfortable while climbing;waist belt and leg loop are lineed with breathable mesh to ensure comfort in warm temperatures.
Two DoubleBack buckles allow waist belt to be adjusted and secured in a single movement. Perfecting for mountaineering and rock climbing outward band fire rescue working on the higher level caving

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
